author: brane
msg: Created new XFAIL test for issue #906 ("failed commit does not remove
txn in the repo"), and made marking such tests simpler.
* svntest/main.py (XFAIL): Make this a function that returns a tuple,
instead of being a simple constant.
schedule_tests.py (test_list): Update to reflect this change.
* commit_tests.py (failed_commit): New XFAIL test for issue #906.

author: sussman
msg: Infrastructure for setting revision properties from client.
No ra_dav support yet, just ra_local.  ra_dav coming soon.
New repository hooks, too: ones that run before and after changing an
unversioned revision property.  We definitely want to let admins
decide exactly how these props are changed; and now we can send
"commit" mails after tweaking log messages as well.
* svn_repos.h (svn_fs_change_rev_prop): new interface for changing a
revision properties, a hook wrapper around the libsvn_fs routine.
run_post_revprop_change_hook): new functions.  Notice that if no
pre-hook exists, we DISALLOW all revpropchanges by default!
(create_hooks):  make two new hook templates at repos creation-time.
* main.c (svn_cl__cmd_table): allow -r option for propset, change help.
* propset-cmd.c (svn_cl__propset):  expand logic, so that -r indicates
a revision propset, instead of a working copy one.

author: kfogel
msg: Abstract the interface for parsing options and arguments, in
preparation for fixing svnadmin's and svnlook's command-line parsing.
Move the old parsing code out of the command-line client:
(svn_cl__options): Redocument.  Also, add the missing 0 placeholder
(svn_cl__cmd_table): This is of type svn_opt_subcommand_desc_t now.
svn_opt_get_canonical_subcommand in opt.c.  All callers changed.
svn_opt_get_option_from_code in opt.c.  All callers changed.
svn_opt_subcommand_takes_option in opt.c.  All callers changed.
svn_opt_print_generic_help in opt.c.  All callers changed.
svn_opt_subcommand_help in opt.c.  All callers changed.
(format_option): Removed, this is now svn_opt_format_option in
Moved these static helper functions to opt.c.
(parse_date): Removed, this is now svn_opt_parse_date in svn_opt.c.
svn_opt_parse_revision in opt.c.  All callers changed.
svn_opt_get_option_from_code in svn_opt.h.  All callers changed.
svn_opt_print_generic_help in svn_opt.h.  All callers changed.
svn_opt_subcommand_help in svn_opt.h.  All callers changed.
svn_opt_parse_revision in svn_opt.h.  All callers changed.
svn_cl__status, svn_cl__switch, svn_cl__update): Declare as type
Trivial adjustments across the client code:
new svn_opt_subcommand_t prototype by taking a void baton and casting
it to svn_cl__opt_state_t; also, fix up a few calls, and document
svn_client_revision_head): Moved to svn_opt.h and renamed to

author: brane
msg: Remove obsolete autoconfiscated constants, and change the default
diff and diff3 locations on Windows, for when those paths can be
set in the user config file.
and SVN_CLIENT_USER_CONF, and change the defaults for SVN_CLIENT_DIFF,

author: gstein
msg: If subversion is built way down in a deep hierarchy, some of the
pathnames that we use for include paths and librarys get to be
*really* long. As a result, it is possible to blast through the line
* Makefile.in: remove $(INCLUDES) and $(CPPFLAGS) from the link steps
for the libraries, executables, and the apache module. We keep
